abstract: Joseph M Hunter, former United States Army sergeant who became mercenary and led effort to kill federal drug agent, is sentenced to 20 years in prison; Hunter was caught in sting operation orchestrated by United States Drug Enforcement Administration in 2013.
lead_paragraph: Joseph M. Hunter, who served in the Army for two decades, had pleaded guilty to conspiring to murder a federal drug agent and a government informer.

headline.main: Ex-Army Sniper Gets 20-Year Sentence in Murder-for-Hire Scheme
headline.print_headline: Ex-Army Sniper Sentenced to 20 Years in a Murder-for-Hire Scheme

snippet: Joseph M. Hunter, who served in the Army for two decades, had pleaded guilty to conspiring to murder a federal drug agent and a government informer.
